name: Unwanted NDN#1
description: Not worthy of the "Art World", something more!

name: Unwanted NDN#2
description: Not worthy of the "Art World", something more.

name: Culture, Forgive Me
description:
The Lambert Wilson Collection

Christian assimilation has always been a complex subject to approach. Growing up in the bible belt, I frequently found myself in church and heavily exposed to the Christian faith. A large part of my adolescence was spent rebelling against the church with sincere negativity. Realizing that directing my negativity towards the faith and teachings of Jesus were illogical. In fact, if the people of the past had been true students of faith, the atrocities and genocide of the past would have never transpired. The true lessons I took away from history and expressed in this piece, are to be wary of the nature of man and decipher any spiritual guidance individually within one's own heart.

Wood: Butternut
Size: 12.5x7.5

name: Booger of Rebellion
description:
A pledge of $5000.00 wil be donated to the Cherokee High School Art program and will sponsor the annual art show. I carved the majority of this piece in the classroom while working at the school. So I thought it would only be fair to complete the circle of creation and give back to the community that allowed me to be free. 

The piece is my depiction of a traditional Cherokee Booger Dancer. The dance has always fascinated me and has been a constant theme in my art. I hand carved the small rattle with traditional materials and techniques. His head is also adorned with buffalo fur and a small turkey feather. He seems intimidating, but the true spirit and meaning of the dance quickly turns fear into comedy. 

Materials: Buckeye, Cedar, Turkey Feathers, Buffalo Fur
Size: 28x6x4.5in

AWARDS
2nd Best of Show (2013 Cherokee Indian Fair)
1st Best large woodcarving (2013 Cherokee Indian Fair)

name: The White Serpent of Truth
description:
The White Serpent of Truth is the 3rd installment in my Sacred Serpent Collection. It was the manifestation of a vision that has been in my mind for as long as I can remember. The search for love, truth and knowledge, is without a doubt, the most important experiences that we humans can hope to pursue. It takes courage to walk these paths. Stated more elegantly here by the "Grand Pappy McKenna": 

“Nature loves courage. You make the commitment and nature will respond to that commitment by removing impossible obstacles. Dream the impossible dream and the world will not grind you under, it will lift you up. This is the trick. This is what all these teachers and philosophers who really counted, who really touched the alchemical gold, this is what they understood. This is the shamanic dance in the waterfall. This is how magic is done. By hurling yourself into the abyss and discovering its a feather bed.” 


― Terence McKenna
  


  Great Serpent mythology has to be one of the most interesting subjects in human history. Most cultures throughout the word have some form of enormous reptilian folklore. In Cherokee culture we have the UKTENA,"The Keen-Eyed" and an amazing legend, filled with little people and the daughter of the Sun. (link below) I am visited by these creatures in my visions and they are ever present in my imagination. My representation is in honor of the Great Serpents and their creators. 

3 of 7

Dimensions: 
21x7x3.5

Materials: 
Buckeye (Wood), Deer Antler, Bird Feathers

Awards:
2nd Best of Show, 2013 Cherokee Indian Fair
1st Place Large Carving, 2013 Cherokee Indian Fair

 Email for More Images

Link:
http://www.sacred-texts.com/nam/cher/motc/motc050.htm 

 57% of this project will be donated to the following Podcasts. I am a rabid listener and supporter of these programs. Thank You for a decent stream of Truth, Vulgarity, Shamanism, History and overall information. I would encourage anyone to "tune in" to these streams of information. You may just end up being a better person.  
   
$1000.00 Joe Rogan Experience Podcast
$1000.00 Duncan Trussell Family Hour Podcast
$1000.00 Psychedelic Salon Podcast
$1000.00 Dan Carlins Hardcore History


http://podcasts.joerogan.net/
http://duncantrussell.com/
http://www.matrixmasters.net/salon/
http://www.dancarlin.com/


Into the Abyss.......

name: Student of Nature
description:
50% ($2500.00) of this transaction will be donated to the Cherokee Elementary School Art Program upon purchase. The donation will be published and documented on my blog. 



 This painting is of a personal hero of mine, Sequoyah. He was responsible for transforming the oral cherokee tongue into a written and readable form. He was the first recorded individually to accomplish such a mission in recorded history and is surrounded in myth and uncertainties. I like to think his genius may have come from communication with the plant world and altered states of consciousness.   
    
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sequoyah

Size:
30x30

Materials:
Acrylic, Stretched Canvas  

Awards:
1st Place 18"+ Painting, 2013 Cherokee Indian Fair

name: Serpent of Uncertainty
description:
Cherokee space snakes, american pyramids, and to much JRE and Graham Hancock. Doing what I do. 


Size:
30x30

Materials: 
Acrylic, Stretched Canvas

name: The Golden Eagle God
description:
There has always been a mystic and other worldly energy emitted from these birds. Throughout human history eagles have been revered and honored by countless cultures and civilizations. My imagination tends to dwell on the grandness of nature from an observer standpoint. Also I hold a strong connection in my own culture being a member of the Bird Clan. In completion of this project, a sincere and undeniable feeling of purpose filled my heart, as if my world had been balanced by the spirit of this mask.     

Interpretations of God are infinite. 

Thank You John for granting me the opportunity to be the conduit for this energy. I am certainly blessed with our friendship. May it bring you balance and peace.

Wood: Butternut
Size: 18x8.5

Glasser Collection

name: Behold The Power of Nature
description:
OG Pencil Sketch

A depiction of the power of nature represented in Cherokee Culture by the mighty U-lû-ñ-sû-'tî, The Blazing Diamond that is roughly translated to "Transparent". The power of creation and destruction walking hand and hand through the mists of time. Rewarding and punishing the conjurer.

(MOONEY, 1900 Myths of the Cherokee, 19th Annual Report, Bureau of American Ethnology)  

Size:
11x14 

Materials:
Pencil, Paper

Awards:
1st Place Pencil Sketch 2013 Cherokee Indian Fair

name: Different World Conflict
description:
OG Pen and Ink (Framed)

A depiction of the ancient battle between the upper and lower worlds.
Contact for prints. 


 

Awards:
2nd Pen and Ink 2013 Cherokee Indian Fair

name: Birth of the Serpent Spirit
description:
This is the second study in the Sacred Serpent Collection. For every story there must be a beginning. Birth of the Serpent Spirit was an attempt to capture that idea.   

Great Serpent mythology has to be one of the most interesting subjects in human history. Most cultures throughout the word have some form of enormous reptilian folklore, which makes it that much more intriguing. 
In Cherokee culture we have the UKTENA,"The Keen-Eyed" and an amazing legend, filled with little people and the daughter of the Sun. (link below) I am visited by these creatures in my visions and they are ever present in my imagination. My representation is in honor of the Great Serpents and their creators. 

2 of 7

Wood: Butternut
Size: 12x3.5x2

Marshall Collection

Link:
http://www.sacred-texts.com/nam/cher/motc/motc050.htm

name: Sixth Gate Gaurdian
description:
A mask strait from my imagination dealing with the paths to enlightenment. The "Sixth Gate Gaurdian" is adorned with a crown of eyes that constantly search for the truth of this world. This one was particularly fun.

Wood: Butternut
Size: 7.5x4.5in

name: Seven Eyed Spirit of Grandeur
description:
My vision of God. This incredibly strong and empowering vision continued to haunt my subconscious for quite some time. Giving the number 7 is sacred in the Cherokee culture, it was fitting to be a major idea lending to the strength of the piece. It is adorned with seven turkey feathers for each realm of existence, centered with a shell symbolizing the one and ultimate truth, that we are all truly one.  I believe that we all have our own interpretation of God to connect with. Though our collective consciousness God becomes infinite within our imaginations. 

  

Size: 21x9x6


Glasser Collection
Thank you John

name: Wide Eyed Native Set
description:
Small mask series, addressing the subject of native peoples view of the world given an accurate, unbiassed, account of history brought forth by the technological age.    
 


McClees Collection

name: Enlightened, The Cherokee Planes-Walker
description:
The awaking of my own consciousness has effected, not only my perception of life, but is now very influential in my artwork. I would never claim to be a shaman or medicine man. Nor would I ever claim complete enlightenment. My artwork allows me to imagine such beautiful states of being in hopes to one day achieve a small grasp of our ever growing universe.     

"If you meet the Buddha on the Road, Kill Him."

Glasser Collection

name: King of the Blind
description:
The all seeing eye, enlightenment, and spirituality have all become major influences in my life. With the upward gaze into the unknown. Love is the key that unlocks the freedom to see past ones self perception. 

Also for you etymology fans: 
"in regione caecorum rex est luscus", Desiderius Erasmus's (Adagia) 1500

Size: 7x4.5x2

Glasser Collection

name: Forgive the Failed Guardians
description:
I constantly think of the responsibility of man. The hunter, the gatherer. The just and unjust. The Provider, the consumer. I wish we could learn to value our gifts over greed. I'm asking for peace. Peace with the buffalo spirit driven away from the mountains in which they loved. Forgive us of our past.         

Size: 13x10x4.5

Glasser Collection
